============================================================================|

=>-Developer...............: Ubisoft Montreal.
=>-Publisher...............: Ubisoft.
=>-Platform................: Windows.
=>-Release date............: 2005.
=>-Genre...................: Stealth.
=>-Mode....................: Single Player : Multi-Player.
=>-Media...................: DVD.
=>-IMBD....................: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0427889/

============================================================================|

Chaos Theory is the third game in the Splinter Cell series endorsed by 
novelist Tom Clancy. As with previous entries in the franchise, Chaos 
Theory follows the activities of Sam Fisher, an agent working for a 
covert-ops branch within the NSA called "Third Echelon". The game has a 
significantly darker tone than its predecessors, featuring more combat 
and the option for Fisher to kill people he interrogates as opposed to 
simply knocking them out. As a result, it was the first Splinter Cell 
game to receive an M-rating by the ESRB, an assessment which has since 
been applied to all subsequent releases in the series. Actor Michael 
Ironside reprised his role as Fisher, while Don Jordan returned from the 
original game to voice Third Echelon director Irving Lambert, having been 
replaced by Dennis Haysbert in Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell Pandora Tomorrow.

============================================================================|

=>-OS..........: Microsoft Windows 2000, XP, Win7.
=>-CPU.........: 2GHz Pentium 4.
=>-RAM.........: 512MB RAM.

=>-HARD DRIVE..: 4 GB Free Space.

============================================================================|
